Class MainController

java.lang.Object
org.robfischer.c482.controller.MainController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class MainController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
The Controller for the Main View in the Inventory Management System.
Author:
Rob Fischer

  • Method Details

    • partSearchHandler

      protected void partSearchHandler()
      Searches for Parts by name, then by ID, when the user presses enter.

    • productSearchHandler

      protected void productSearchHandler()
      Searches for Products by name, then by ID, when the user presses enter.

    • onDeletePartButtonClick

      protected void onDeletePartButtonClick()
      Deletes the selected part. Prompts the user to confirm, then deletes a Part, if one is selected in the partTable. Prompts the user to select a Part, if one is not selected.

    • onDeleteProductButtonClick

      protected void onDeleteProductButtonClick()
      Deletes the selected product. Prompts the user to confirm, then deletes a Product, if one is selected in the productTable. Prompts the user to select a Product, if one is not selected.

    • openAddPart

      protected void openAddPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Opens the Add Part View, and sets the controller to AddPartController.

      Opens the Add Product View, and sets the controller to AddProductController.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The ActionEvent which triggered this method.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • openEditPart

      protected void openEditPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Opens the Add Part View, and sets the controller to EditPartController. Passes EditPartController a Part to edit, if one is selected.

      RUNTIME ERROR: Initially I had the fx-controller set in add-part-view to AddPartController. I then tried to call loader.setController to change to the EditPart Controller. This resulted in a runtime error, which was subsequently corrected by removing the fx-controller attribute from the fxml, and setting the controller for both Add Part and Edit part in their respective methods.

      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The ActionEvent which triggered this method.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • openEditProduct

      protected void openEditProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Opens the Add Product View, and sets the controller to EditProductController. Passes EditProductController the Product to edit, if one is selected.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The ActionEvent which triggered this method.
      Throws:
      IOException
